column4: Dr: if you need another machine you can have my Dell Outlet script
that's why I haven't bought anything off the outlet
we were 2 desktops/2 laptops and now we are 1/2
and soon we may be 1/2 with the desktop being replaced by a server
I don't use a machine that has 256
I remember people were like "64 megs on a 166? Your _never_ going to need that much ram"
ok so here is the dumb question of the hour: how do you tell what package owns a given file or directory?
I knew,  I forgot, and for the life of me I can't remember
if it's not installed, get 'apt-file' and that will tell you
you know you can "man dpkg" to see the flags, right?
I checked and didn't see it
after doing "man dpkg" type "/search" and hit return
then hit 'n' a few times 'til it finds it
